intro: Erophila inflata, commonly known as the inflated erophila, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble small, balloon-like structures. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant.
